question: The Turing model characterizes a computer as a __________.
In the von Neumann model, both program and data are stored in the same __________.
Which CPU component performs arithmetic and logical operations?
The control unit primarily __________.
The stored-program idea is most associated with __________.
A universal Turing machine can compute __________.
Which device pioneered program control using punched cards?
First-generation electronic computers primarily used __________.
The set of disciplines directly related to creating hardware and system software are often called the __________ areas of computer science.
The basic cycle in a stored-program machine is often described as __________.
In a positional system, a digit’s value depends on the digit and its __________.
Binary digits are also known as __________.
Hexadecimal uses base __________.
Four binary bits correspond neatly to one __________ digit.
Three binary bits correspond neatly to one __________ digit.
The maximum unsigned value represented by K binary digits is __________.
To convert from base b to decimal, multiply each digit by powers of b and then __________.
The Roman numeral system is an example of a __________ system.
The binary number (101.11)_2 equals __________ in decimal.
The function symbols ⌈ ⌉ in ⌈log_b N⌉ denote the __________ function.
Which base is most convenient for human interpretation of binary machine values?
In hexadecimal, the digit 'C' corresponds to decimal __________.
Converting a decimal fraction to another base commonly uses repeated __________.
In dotted decimal notation for IP, each 'dot' separates a base-256 __________.
Inside a computer, all data types are ultimately represented as __________.
An unsigned 8-bit value represents integers in the range __________.
In sign-and-magnitude, the leftmost bit stores the __________.
Two’s complement has how many representations of zero?
IEEE 754 single precision uses __________ bits.
In IEEE single precision, the exponent bias is __________.
ASCII originally used __________ bits per character.
Audio digitization commonly involves sampling, quantization, and __________.
Raster graphics represent images as a grid of __________.
Vector graphics encode images as mathematical descriptions of __________.
MP3 is primarily a __________ compression format for audio.
In IEEE floating-point, the mantissa (fraction) determines the number’s __________.
The Excess (biased) representation is used to store the __________ in IEEE floats.
Underflow in floating-point occurs when the magnitude is too __________ to represent.
Truncation error in floats often results from limiting the number of __________ bits.
Text encoding of many modern scripts is standardized through __________.
Image 'True-Color' commonly uses __________ bits per pixel.
Indexed color images map pixel values to a small __________ of RGB triples.
NOT, AND, OR, and XOR are __________ operations.
A bitwise AND with a mask bit of 0 will __________ the corresponding bit.
A logical left shift on an 8-bit pattern drops the MSB and inserts __________ at the LSB.
An arithmetic right shift on two’s complement values replicates the __________.
In two’s complement arithmetic, A − B is computed as A + __________.
Overflow in two’s complement addition occurs when adding two numbers with the same sign produces a result with __________.
XOR with a mask bit of 1 will __________ the targeted bit.
Rotate (circular shift) operations differ from simple shifts because they __________.
Arithmetic left shift of a valid two’s complement number corresponds to __________ by 2 (if no overflow).
A mask of 11110000 (binary) used with OR will __________ the four leftmost bits.
To test a specific bit, a common idiom is to right shift then __________ with 1.
One’s complement of a bit pattern is obtained by __________ each bit.
Two’s complement can be computed by one’s complement followed by adding __________.
A simple right shift on an unsigned quantity is equivalent to integer __________ by 2.
Combining a rotation with an AND mask is often used to __________ fields in a word.
Setting bits is typically implemented with a(n) __________ operation.
Registers are small, fast storage locations inside the __________.
The program counter holds the address of the __________ instruction.
Cache is typically __________ than main memory and __________ in size.
DRAM stores each bit using a tiny __________.
SRAM is often used to implement __________.
ROM is __________ and generally used for firmware.
Address space is the number of uniquely addressable __________.
In a 32 MB byte-addressable memory, the number of address bits required is __________.
The 80–20 rule helps justify the performance benefit of __________.
Pipelining improves CPU __________.
RISC stands for Reduced __________ Computer.
The instruction register (IR) holds the instruction currently being __________.
EEPROM differs from EPROM by supporting __________ erasure.
In hierarchical memory, the fastest and most costly per byte is typically __________.
Magnetic disks organize data in concentric __________ divided into sectors.
A magnetic tape is a __________ access device.
CD-ROMs encode data using pits and lands read by a __________.
A controller that moves data between memory and device with minimal CPU is often called __________.
The five-layer Internet model places HTTP at the __________ layer.
TCP provides a reliable, byte-stream service, while UDP is __________.
Routers primarily operate at the __________ layer.
Switches forward frames based on __________ addresses.
DNS translates domain names to __________.
SMTP is used primarily for __________.
Common transmission media include twisted pair, coaxial cable, and __________.
The unit of data at the Transport layer is typically called a __________.
The unit of data at the Data-Link layer is known as a __________.
The Physical layer concerns __________ transmission characteristics.
A subnet mask separates the network and __________ portions of an IP address.
HTTP is a stateless protocol layered over __________.
ARP is used to map IP addresses to __________ addresses.
A socket is identified by an IP address and a __________ number.
MTU stands for Maximum __________ Unit.
ICMP is often used for network __________.
At the Application layer, FTP is primarily used for __________.
The unit of data at the Network layer is commonly called a __________.
An operating system acts primarily as a __________ manager.
A process is a program in __________.
Round-robin scheduling is based on __________.
Deadlock is a condition where processes __________.
Virtual memory combines RAM with __________.
A context switch saves and restores the __________ state.
A file system organizes files and __________.
A monolithic kernel runs most services in __________ mode.
Semaphores and mutexes are used to achieve __________.
Thrashing occurs when the system spends most time __________.
A device driver is typically a module that manages a specific __________.
A system call is the interface from user programs to __________ services.
The scheduler decides which process should __________ next.
In memory management, paging divides memory into fixed-size __________.
Segmented memory divides address space into variable-size __________.
A page table maps virtual page numbers to physical __________.
An algorithm must be finite, effective, and __________.
The three basic control structures are sequence, selection, and __________.
Pseudocode expresses algorithms independent of language-specific __________.
Big-O notation gives an asymptotic __________ bound.
Binary search requires the input array to be __________.
Recursion typically solves a problem by solving smaller __________.
A stable sort preserves the relative order of records with equal __________.
Divide-and-conquer solves subproblems and then __________ the results.
Greedy algorithms make __________ optimal choices at each step.
Flowcharts use standardized diagrammatic symbols to depict __________.
A correct algorithm must eventually __________ on all valid inputs.
A subalgorithm is a module invoked by another algorithm to perform a __________ task.
Algorithmic complexity often counts basic __________ operations.
Recurrence relations frequently describe the complexity of __________ algorithms.
A compiler translates source code into __________.
An interpreter executes a program by performing __________ translation.
Procedural languages follow the __________ paradigm.
In OOP, a class defines a type; objects are its __________.
Static typing performs type checking at __________.
Syntax describes form; semantics describes __________.
Functional programming emphasizes __________ functions.
Lexical scope binds names according to the program’s __________ structure.
A linker resolves references among __________ files.
Bytecode is typically executed by a __________ machine.
Imperative languages use statements that change program __________.
A programming paradigm is a style or approach to __________.
The SDLC typically includes analysis, design, implementation, testing, and __________.
Requirements engineering produces a __________ specification.
Unit testing targets individual software __________.
Black-box testing focuses on __________ behavior.
UML stands for Unified Modeling __________.
A use-case diagram captures __________ interactions.
Agile methods emphasize __________ feedback and iteration.
Version control systems track and manage changes to __________.
Refactoring improves code structure without changing __________.
Integration testing verifies the interactions between __________.
A structure chart depicts the hierarchical organization of __________.
In UML, a class diagram primarily shows classes and their __________.
Documentation is important for maintainability and user __________.
Regression testing ensures new changes have not broken existing __________.
An array provides __________ access by index.
A record groups fields of possibly __________ types.
A singly linked list node contains data and a pointer to the __________ node.
Random access to the i-th element of an array is typically __________ time.
In a linked list, insertion at head can be performed in __________ time.
A dynamic array grows by allocating a larger block and __________ elements.
In a circular linked list, the tail node points to the __________.
A doubly linked list supports traversal in __________ directions.
Arrays are best when frequent operations are __________.
Linked lists are best when frequent operations are __________.
Records (structs) are useful for grouping related fields into a single __________.
The time to search for a value in an unsorted array is typically __________.
Sequential files are best suited for __________ access.
Indexed files use a(n) __________ to locate records quickly.
Hashed files compute storage locations using a __________ function.
Directories map file names to __________.
Text files store data as sequences of __________.
Binary files store data as raw __________.
Record-oriented files group data into fixed or variable-length __________.
A primary index is typically built on the file’s __________ key.
Overflow areas in hashing handle __________.
B+ trees are widely used for __________ file organizations.
A file header commonly stores metadata such as format and __________.
Fixed-length records simplify computing a record’s __________.
The relational model organizes data into __________.
A primary key uniquely identifies a __________ in a table.
A foreign key references a primary key in a(n) __________ table.
Normalization reduces data __________.
SQL SELECT is used to __________ data.
ACID stands for Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and __________.
An object-oriented database integrates database features with __________ concepts.
An object-relational database aims to keep relational advantages and support __________ data.
Indexes primarily speed up __________ performance.
ER modeling captures entities, attributes, and __________.
A relation is a set of tuples; each tuple corresponds to a __________.
A schema defines the __________ of the database.
A join combines rows from two tables based on a related __________.
Functional dependencies underpin the theory of database __________.
A view is a __________ table defined by a query.
The relational algebra operation that filters rows is called __________.
A Turing machine is a formal model of __________.
The halting problem is __________.
Class P contains problems solvable in __________ time.
NP stands for Non-deterministic __________ time.
If A reduces to B in polynomial time and B is in P, then A is __________.
A language is decidable if some Turing machine __________ on every input.
Gödel numbering encodes formal objects as __________.
Regular languages are recognized by __________ automata.
Context-free languages are generated by __________ grammars.
The complexity of problems concerns the __________ resources needed.
A reduction shows that solving one problem can be transformed into solving __________.
Closure properties describe which language classes are closed under given __________.
Knowledge representation includes logic, frames, and __________ networks.
An expert system typically includes a knowledge base and an __________ engine.
Heuristic search uses rules of thumb to guide __________.
A perceptron is a basic model of a __________ neuron.
Backpropagation is used to train __________ networks.
Perception in AI often includes processing of __________.
State-space search explores nodes connected by __________.
A* search combines path cost and a(n) __________ estimate.
Overfitting occurs when a model learns __________ instead of general patterns.
Rule-based systems represent knowledge as sets of __________ rules.
A social network connects users via __________ relationships.
A 'feed' commonly shows a stream of __________.
Hashtags enable content __________ by topic.
A 'follower' relationship is typically __________ directional.
Intellectual property concerns rights over __________.
Privacy relates to control over personal __________.
Computer crime can include unauthorized access, fraud, and __________.
Ethical principles often include beneficence and __________.
Plagiarism is presenting another’s work as __________.
Fair use may permit limited use of copyrighted material for __________ purposes.
